dict.string: Quickly access toggles that are most important to you inside of the app switcher by swiping left on the first card in the switcher.
Swipe down on any app in the app switcher to prevent it from being closed.
iPhone X (or HomeGesture) users can access the Control Center by swiping up on the bottom of the screen and then left.
Access the Control Center in App Switcher view.
Choose the way you want to access the Control Center.
Automatically lock applications that play audio.
If enabled, prevent apps from being closed only with the Close All Quick Action.
Feel a haptic response when locking an app.
Put apps’ icon and name below the card.
Enable a page-like behaviour in the control center view.
Select the type of scroll you want.
Enable the feature even with all apps cleared (app switcher will have to be manually dismissed).
Change the position of the Control Center in Multi-Side.
Reset Multi-Side content offset when invoking Control Center.
Quick shortcut to manage your control center modules.
Feel a haptic response when using Side-by-Side.
By default, swiping up on the home screen will invoke Side-by-Side. Prioritise App Switcher disables this.
Put apps’ icon and name below the card.
Display a series of toggles on the right side of the switcher.
Enable the feature even with all apps cleared (app switcher will have to be manually dismissed).
Manage quick actions. You can have a maximum of 5 (4 is Multi-Side is enabled) quick actions enabled at time.
Feel a haptic response when activating a Quick Action.
Darken the color of the Quick Action toggles.
Set an interval of holding a Quick Action toggle before activating it. Use this to prevent accidental activation of a toggle.
Set how many rows Multi-Side can display
Make the cards in app switcher follow a linear rule instead of a deck rule (This will overwrite Grid Switcher and will not work with Reduce Motion).
Make the cards in app switcher follow a linear rule instead of a deck rule (This will overwrite Grid Switcher and will not work with Reduce Motion).
A Respring is required in order to apply Linear Switcher
